column4: Column: Jeff Bezos has two words for you: ‘No comment.'
column5: When journalists pressed William Henry Vanderbilt in 1882 about his plan to discontinue his railroad's popular but unprofitable mail run  the richest man in the world reportedly exclaimed  "The public be damned!" Whether Vanderbilt said "be damned" or not — he claimed to have been misquoted — business titans of the Gilded Age routinely assumed this default posture.

column4: Amazon.com back up after going down for U.S.  Canadian users

column4: Column: How long did JPMorgan (allegedly) deceive investors?
column5: NEW YORK Last week's criminal complaints against former JPMorgan Chase derivatives traders Javier Martin-Artajo and Julien Grout - who allegedly mismarked positions in the bank's infamous synthetic credit derivatives portfolio to hide hundreds of millions of dollars of trading losses in early 2012 by the JPMorgan Chief Investment Office - does not directly impact the shareholder class action under way in federal court in Manhattan.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Fed fears drive TSX to biggest drop in eight weeks
column5: * TSX falls 148.86 points  or 1.17 percent  to 12 588.06     * All 10 main index sectors decline     * Canadian Natural has biggest negative influence on market     * B2Gold tumbles more than 13 percent after senior note offering      By John Tilak     TORONTO  Aug 19 Canada's main stock index recorded its biggest single-day percentage fall in eight weeks on Monday as concerns about the U.S. Federal Reserve's exit strategy for its stimulus program hit energy and financial shares.
